jobDescription: Research Engineering/ Scientist Assistant Hiring department Ices-PI-Sacks Monthly salary $2,500+ depending on qualifications Hours per week 40.00 Flexible from 700AM to 1000PM Posting number 18-07-02-01-4222 Job Status Open FLSA status Non-exempt Earliest Start Date 07/09/2018 Position Duration Funding expected to continue Position open to all applicants Location Austin (main campus) Number of vacancies 1  General Notes Knowledge of basic clean lab techniques, excellent manual skills, basic microscopy and image capturing, and organization and laboratory record keeping are all required. On the software side, as all the instruments are controlled by LabView, knowledge of this software package essential. Resume, letter of interest and list of 3 references required. Required Application Materials  A Resume is required in order to apply  A Letter of Interest is required in order to apply.  A List of 3 References is required in order to apply.  Additional Information  Purpose Perform or assist in the experimentally focused EERC lab operations in the Willerson Center for Cardiovascular Modeling and Simulation under direction of Professor Sacks in the Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences and the Department of Biomedical Engineering. Lab is located on the 7th floor of EER Bldg. Essential Functions Conduct basic to moderately complex multi-axial biomechanical experimental studies on soft tissues, biomaterials, and cells that will lead to co-authored publications. Prepare detailed technical reports and specific sections of project plans, as well as any modifications to the equipment and any required computer programing. There will also be opportunities to assist research associates, postdoctoral fellows and faculty with specific phases of research projects. Oversee day to day EER lab operations, including ordering of supplies, equipment maintenance and upkeep, undergo necessary training, scheduling, maintenance and security. Ensure students have completed annual safety training and related training per university rules. Marginal/Incidental functions Assist with laboratory tours and lab PR as needed. Other related functions as assigned. Required qualifications Bachelor's degree in a scientific, engineering or technical field. The ideal candidate will have experience in conducting mechanical tests on soft materials and analyzing and compiling the data. All the lab instruments are controlled by LabView, knowledge of this software package is required. Equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Biomedical Engineering or a related field. One or more years as a laboratory assistant in biomedical/computational field. Additional software skills using Matlab and especially Python and associated scientific libraries. Working conditions May work around chemical fumes May work around standard office conditions May work around chemicals Repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation Use of manual dexterity The WCCMS EER lab is a new, state of the art open-lab design research building. Most of the EER lab is complete and setup.
